docs.text: capsule : one of the ten worst movies ever made .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: christopher lambert vs . evil ninjas in modern-day japan . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and nobody wins .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the hunted is such a bad movie , so completely inept and so totally brain-damaged that i could almost feel affection for it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i could see myself showing this movie to friends and getting a good jolly guffaw out of it , if it weren't also insanely xenophobic and insulting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: christopher lambert plays a computer-parts salesman who's on business in japan .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he meets a slinky young woman ( joan chen ) and has a torrid night of lovemaking with her -- and then manages to witness her death at the hands of an evil ninja clan and their leader ( john lone ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: apparently they had some unfinished business that could only be concluded with her getting slaughtered .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since lambert is a witness , he's of course the next one to die .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: let's stop and think about this for a second .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if lambert were in real life being chased by fanatical devotees to a ninja secret society , he'd have a lifespan you could only measure with an atomic clock .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in this movie , the ninja manage to kill just about everyone except him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i imagine the japanese gods smiled down on lambert and provided him with a goof field that radiates out about ten feet from his body .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you know what a goof field is : that invisible zone in which anyone who has intent to do harm to you becomes a klutz no matter what their real dexterity is .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is , of course , only the beginning of the movie's problems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lambert eventually finds pseudo-safety with a long-haired modern-day samurai ( yoshio harada ) and his partner -- yoko shimada , who you may remember as lady toda buntaro in shogun .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they are the two best things in the movie ; in every scene they have authority and presence , and they actually look like they belong here , even when dressed in full samurai armor and wielding bows .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script doesn't know what the hell to do with them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: lone , as the bad guy , is zero-dimensional .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only bad-guy cliche he has to wallow around in is the one about how the bad guy always has exotic women dripping off of him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the hunted , this is elevated to the level of an insulting stereotype .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what's funny is that the peripheral characters in the hunted are not sterotypes -- there's a nice little scene with a tokyo cabdriver , and a girl in a pachinko parlor -- but many of the main characters are unsalveageably hateful .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: also , the phenomenal instrumental troupe kodo has assembled a superior soundtrack -- get the cd -- that manages to survive despite the drek it's been designed to accompany .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there is an extended battle scene in the middle of the movie that is almost reason enough to watch the whole thing -- a gory , excellently staged fight on the bullet train that shows some real imagination for a moment , and then smothers it by trying to clumsily re-couple the whole thing with the movie's relentlessly stupid plot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: by the time we get to the final showdown , with lambert getting to wield his own sword ( which , judging from the ham-handed editing of one scene , was forged in seven hours or so ) , we no longer care .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we're not even given any definitive information about whether or not one of the key characters lives or dies !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: someone once said that the key to good art -- good movies , good books , whatever -- is to start somewhere interesting , end up somewhere interesting , and show respect for the audience all along the way .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this movie bungles two out of three , badly .
docs.label: negative
